DataElement.preferredName: Second and Third Sitting Diastolic Average Derived Result in Millimeter of Mercury Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Derived computed average of the second and third sequential diastolic blood pressure measurements.  The zero value is subtracted from the readings to get the actual (corrected) diastolic measurements; these are then averaged.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Second and Third Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure Average
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Computed average of the second and third sequential diastolic blood pressure measurements.  The zero value is subtracted from the readings to get the actual (corrected) diastolic measurements; these are then averaged.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:Following the second position in an ordering or series.:The blood pressure after the contraction of the heart while the chambers of the heart refill with blood.

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Following the second position in an ordering or series; coming next after the second and just before the fourth in position.
The minimum pressure exerted into the systemic arterial circulation during cardiac ventricular relaxation and filling.

Property.preferredDefinition: The central tendency of a set of n numbers; lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered.

Concepts.definition: A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Blood Pressure Result in Millimeter of Mercury Number
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Result of a diastolic or systolic blood pressure reading, expressed as a numeric value in millimeters of mercury (mmHg) to the nearest even number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Computed average of second and third pressure measurements

DataElement.changeDescription: CDE based on the ABI manual specifications for the ARIC study.
